string-array.name: tips_array
string-array.item: Carpool with commuters that share similar trips to yours.
If looking to get a new car, take into consideration fuel efficiency when choosing which vehicle to get.
If possible, take a bus instead of a taxi or other forms of single-passenger transportation.
Try to prevent stopping and accelerating as much as you can when driving.
If in traffic, turn off your engine if idling for long periods of time.
Try to take the most direct path to your destination to avoid taking detours that will add to your trip length.
If going short distances, consider walking, biking, or other forms of zero-emission transportation.
Make sure your wheels are fully inflated, as flatter tires greatly increase your emissions.
Taking shorter showers can help greatly reduce the amount of hot water you consume, which will reduce your carbon footprint.
Washing clothes in cold water will reduce the amount of unnecessary hot water you use.
Turning off heating in the warmer months will drastically decrease the amount of gas used for heating.
Put a sweatshirt on instead of turning up the heat when cold.
Using compact fluorescent light bulbs will cut down on your electric bill and also increase the brightness of the rooms you're trying to light!
Unplugging electrical appliances that aren't in use will reduce the amount of ambient electricity you use.
During the warmer months, hang your clothes up to dry instead of using a drying machine to cut down on your electric bill.
If going on vacation, turn off the heating in your house and put your water heater on "vacation" setting if possible.
